intro: Pristiglottis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered pristiglottis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Pristiglottidaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and specialized root system. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its reproductive strategy involves wind pollination, which is adapted to its low-growing habit. Due to habitat loss, Pristiglottis uniflora is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
